H0.text: The adaptive immune system possesses a memory component that allows for an efficient and dramatic response upon reinvasion of the same pathogen.

H1.text: The incorporate immune system possesses a memory component that allows for an efficient and dramatic response upon reinvasion of the same pathogen.

H2.text: The societal immune system possesses a memory component that allows for an efficient and dramatic response upon reinvasion of the same pathogen.

H3.text: The suggestive immune system possesses a memory component that allows for an efficient and dramatic response upon reinvasion of the same pathogen.

A4.text: Adaptive immunity creates immunological memory after an initial response to a specific pathogen, and leads to an enhanced response to future encounters with that pathogen.

A5.text: Upon interaction with a previously encountered antigen, the appropriate memory cells are selected and activated. In this manner, the second and subsequent exposures to an antigen produce a stronger and faster immune response.
